page.title: 15SURROUNDINGS IN NENTHEAD
page.content: Standing by the River Nent in the village I can see spoil heaps on either side with very little vegetation. New varieties of grasses and trees have been planted on them this year. Behind Wright's Garage is a huge spoil heap with some large trees growing on it. Narrow steep-sided head water valleys which abound in this area aare known as gills or Cloughs suggesting Norse or Scandinavian settlement at an earlier time. The Hush has the biggest group of Trees in Nenthead. The Hush was used by miners looking for lead ore. Miners built a dam on the fell, when it was full it would be blown up. The sudden rush of water would make a gorge in which miners could find minerals.
